Package com.ibm.eznosql.exception

Class InputValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.eznosql.exception.InputValidator
  • public class InputValidator
extends java.lang.Object
    InputValidator is a helper class that performs basic String parameter validation for known format violations. In most cases, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown when a null or empty string is detected.

    • Method Detail

      • validateKeyName

        public static void validateKeyName​(java.lang.String key)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Performs String parameter validation on a key name.
        Parameters:
        key - The key name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the key is null, empty, or contains only whitespaces. If the key length exceeds the maximum length of 255 characters.

      • validateDatasetName

        public static void validateDatasetName​(java.lang.String dataset)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Performs String parameter validation on a data set name.
        Parameters:
        dataset - The data set name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the data set name is null, empty, or contains only whitespaces. If the data set name exceeds the maximum length of 44 characters. If the data set name exceeds the maximum length of 44 characters. If the data set name does not meet z/OS data set naming requirements.

      • validateString

        public static void validateString​(java.lang.String str)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Performs String parameter validation.
        Parameters:
        str - The string to be validated
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the data set name is null, empty, or contains only whitespaces.
